[[File:AMCMTheatricalPoster.jpg|thumb|Theatrical release poster]]

'''''A Minecraft Movie''''' is a 2025 American adventure comedy film based on the video game ''[[Minecraft]]''. It is directed by [[Jared Hess]] and written by Chris Bowman, {{w|Hubbel Palmer}}, Neil Widener, Gavin James, and {{w|Chris Galletta}}, from a story by {{w|Allison Schroeder}}, Bowman, and Palmer.<ref name="WGACredit">{{citation|url=https://directories.wga.org/project/1235768/minecraft/|title=Minecraft - WGA Directory|website=WGA Directory|date=31 January 2025}}</ref>

Plans for the film originated in February 2014 when [[Markus Persson]] announced that the film was in development at [[Warner Bros. Pictures]]. However, the film ultimately did not leave the pre-production phase until April 2022, when it was reported that Jared Hess was set to direct the film and [[Jason Momoa]] was attached to star. Further casting was announced between May 2023 and January 2024, with {{w|Principal photography|principal photography}} beginning that month and wrapping in April 2024.

''A Minecraft Movie'' had its {{AMCM|green carpet|premiere}} held at the {{w|Empire Leicester Square}} in London, England, on March 30, 2025,<ref>{{tweet|WarnerBrosUK|1899137596451926117|Jason Momoa, Jack Black, Danielle Brooks, Jennifer Coolidge & more are coming to London on March 30 for the World Premiere of #MinecraftMovie üôå|March 10, 2025}}</ref> and was theatrically released in the United States by [[Warner Bros. Pictures]] on April 4, 2025.<ref name="Teaser"> {{ytl|PE2YZhcC4NY|A Minecraft Movie {{!}} Teaser|Warner Bros. Pictures|September 4, 2024}}</ref>

The film has received mixed to negative reviews from critics, but has been a box-office success, grossing $958 million worldwide against a budget of $150 million, making it the {{w|List of highest-grossing films based on video games|second-highest grossing film based on a video game}}, the {{w|List of American films of 2025|highest-grossing domestic film of 2025}}, and the {{w|2025 in film#Highest-grossing films|fifth-highest grossing film worldwide of 2025}}, subsequently making it Jared Hess' highest-grossing film to date.

A [[Untitled Minecraft film|sequel]] is in development and is slated to be released on July 23, 2027.

== Synopsis ==
{{Quote|Four misfits‚ÄîGarrett "The Garbage Man" Garrison (Momoa), Henry ([[Sebastian Eugene Hansen|Hansen]]), Natalie ([[Emma Myers|Myers]]) and Dawn ([[Danielle Brooks|Brooks]])‚Äîfind themselves struggling with ordinary problems when they are suddenly pulled through a mysterious portal into the Overworld: a bizarre, cubic wonderland that thrives on imagination. To get back home, they‚Äôll have to master this world (and protect it from evil things like piglins and zombies, too) while embarking on a magical quest with an unexpected, expert crafter, Steve ([[Jack Black|Black]]). Together, their adventure will challenge all five to be bold and to reconnect with the qualities that make each of them uniquely creative... the very skills they need to thrive back in the real world.|Warner Bros. Pictures and Mojang Studios<ref name="WarnerBros.Com"/>}}

== Plot ==
{{SpoilerWarning|section|''A Minecraft Movie''}}
Steve had a passion to explore the {{AMCM|mine}} since he was young, but wasn't allowed to do so with his young age. He settled for an office job years later, but feeling discontent, he remembered the mines and returned to them, finally able to explore. While mining, he came across the {{AMCM|Earth Crystal}} and the {{AMCM|Orb of Dominance}}; combining the two formed the {{AMCM|Earth Cube}}, which activated an {{AMCM|Earth Portal}}, in which he discovers the {{AMCM|Overworld}}. There, he tames and befriends a {{AMCM|wolf}} named {{AMCM|Dennis}} and becomes an expert builder. One day, Steve discovers an {{AMCM|obsidian gateway}} and, upon reactivating it, enters the {{AMCM|Nether}}. He encounters {{AMCM|Malgosha}}, the leader of the {{AMCM|piglin}}s, who despises creativity and has wished to demolish the Overworld for gold since being mocked at a talent show she joined in her childhood. Malgosha imprisons Steve and Dennis, who escape with the Orb of Dominance. Steve instructs Dennis to go to {{AMCM|Earth}} and hide the orb under his bed at home. Steve is imprisoned once again as Dennis escapes into Earth.

Years later, {{AMCM|Garrett Garrison}}, nicknamed "The Garbage Man" after becoming the {{AMCM|World Video Game Championship|video game champion}} of 1989, runs a store known as {{AMCM|Game Over World}} in {{AMCM|Chuglass}}, {{AMCM|Idaho}}, but receives an eviction notice. He heads to a storage unit that is said to hold an {{w|Atari Cosmos}}, hoping to sell it at his shop. Garrett wins the unit, but the Atari Cosmos is nowhere to be found. He trashes the unit before leaving, upset at his misfortune, but his car soon breaks down. Meanwhile, {{AMCM|Henry}} and {{AMCM|Natalie}} move into Chuglass following the death of their {{AMCM|Henry's Mother|mother}}. They meet their estate agent, {{AMCM|Dawn}}, who introduces them to their home. The next morning, Henry visits Game Over World before school and meets Garrett, who offers to mentor him. Upon arriving at {{AMCM|Chuglass High School}}, he is greeted by {{AMCM|Vice Principal Marlene}} and begins art class. He builds a {{AMCM|jetpack}}, which wows the students, but after being sabotaged by {{AMCM|Trevor}} and {{AMCM|Trevor's Friend|his friend}}, the jetpack goes haywire and crashes into the local {{AMCM|Chuglass Potato Chips|potato chip factory}}. Henry is nearly expelled, but Garrett pretends to be his uncle and picks him up. Back at Game Over World, Henry notices the Orb of Dominance and combines it with the Earth Crystal, dragging him to the mineshaft. Dawn and Natalie follow him and Garrett into the mineshaft, and they are all dragged through the portal into the Overworld. As they take in their surroundings, a {{AMCM|nitwit}} secretly goes through the portal and enters Earth.

Malgosha soon discovers that the Orb has returned, and frees Steve on the condition that he retrieves the Orb for her. He obliges, but attempts a sneak attack. Malgosha threatens to kill Dennis if Steve does not oblige, forcing him to reluctantly accept. Dennis then heads into the mineshaft, goes through the portal, and returns to the Overworld. Meanwhile, it becomes nighttime in the Overworld, and the {{AMCM|gang}} is attacked by numerous hostile {{AMCM|mob}}s. Garrett escapes through a tunnel underground, while Henry builds a house to protect him, Natalie, and Dawn. Garrett emerges beneath the surface and makes it to the house, but the cube is destroyed by a {{AMCM|skeleton}}'s arrow. The group are cornered by {{AMCM|zombie}}s but are soon rescued by Steve as it becomes daytime. He introduces himself and agrees to help the misfits return home, planning to do so by stealing another crystal from the {{AMCM|Woodland Mansion}}. Meanwhile, the nitwit gets hit by Marlene's car, and Marlene offers to take the nitwit out for dinner.

Upon arriving at {{AMCM|Midport Village}}, Steve introduces the group to the {{AMCM|villager}}s, and leads them to {{AMCM|Steve's Lava Chicken!}} and {{AMCM|Steve's Secret Stash!|his stash}}. In the Nether, Malgosha orders {{AMCM|General Chungus}} to lead an army into the village and kill the humans. In the Overworld, Steve introduces Henry and Garrett to the {{AMCM|crafting table}}, crafting an {{AMCM|iron sword}}. Garrett then crafts {{AMCM|Buck-Chuckets|two buckets connected to a chain}}, and Henry crafts a {{AMCM|tot launcher}} using items from Earth. As Dawn and Natalie meet the {{AMCM|cartographer}}, the village is attacked by General Chungus and his army. The humans get the upper hand and eventually escape, splitting up in the process. Steve, Henry, and Garrett escape with {{AMCM|elytra}} and are {{AMCM|Elytra Wingsuits Flying Escape|chased through the air}} by piglins and {{AMCM|ghast}}s. Dawn and Natalie attempt to craft a boat to follow the cartographer, but are unable to do so. Meanwhile, on Earth, Marlene goes on a date with the nitwit and expresses feelings towards him, which are reciprocated.

Steve, Garrett, and Henry then head for the {{AMCM|Redstone Mountains}}, with the woodland mansion just beyond them. Malgosha fires General Chungus, who is killed by the {{AMCM|Great Hog}}. Dawn and Natalie encounter Dennis and tame him, and Dawn asks Dennis to take them to Steve. In the Redstone Mines, Steve, Garrett, and Henry find Steve's stash of {{AMCM|diamond}}s, as Garrett secretly requested to Steve earlier that he may bring home diamonds to pay his debts. They are interrupted by the Great Hog and escape through a {{AMCM|minecart}} track, killing the Great Hog in Steve's {{AMCM|creeper}} farm. Henry and Garrett then get into a heated argument, while on Earth, Marlene and the nitwit are still having a dinner date.

Henry, Garrett, and Steve soon arrive at the woodland mansion. As previously planned, Henry retrieves the Earth Crystal to combine it with the orb, while Garrett and Steve distract the {{AMCM|illager}}s with a {{AMCM|Birthday Rap}} song. Henry eventually finds the crystal, but is attacked by an {{AMCM|enderman}}, all while Steve and Garrett are subjected to a fight with a {{AMCM|chicken jockey}}. After Henry defeats the enderman and the other two win the fight, the three escape. Outside, they are cornered by Malgosha and her army, who steals the orb and reveals she made a {{AMCM|New Hog}}. Henry and Steve escape on a lone ghast while Garrett sacrifices himself to hold off the piglins, seemingly being caught in a {{AMCM|TNT}} explosion. After Henry and Steve crash-land on grass, they are taken to the {{AMCM|Mushroom Safe House}} built by Dawn. Steve is happily reunited with Dennis while Henry and Natalie apologize and reconcile. Malgosha gives the orb to two piglins, who place the orb atop a giant Nether portal, blocking out the sun and spawning {{AMCM|Nether wart}} everywhere, thus beginning the {{AMCM|Great Darkening}}.

Steve, Henry, Natalie, and Dawn work together to stop the piglins, building {{AMCM|iron golem}}s to take down the army, while Steve faces Malgosha with {{AMCM|diamond armor}}. Henry heads up to the orb using an {{AMCM|ender pearl}} with his tot launcher, and Dawn sends Dennis and a pack of wolves after the piglins. Henry attempts to retrieve the orb, but is attacked by the New Hog. Garrett saves Henry using the ghast he hijacked and fires fireballs at the Nether portal, destroying it, and zombifying the piglins in the process. Retrieving the orb, the misfits are able to head back home. Steve allows Dennis to go live with Dawn, and after Natalie suggests that Steve head into the real world, he decides to join them. On Earth, Steve assists Garrett in creating a new arcade game, ''{{AMCM|Block City Battle Buddies}}'', and forms a band with him. Dawn leaves her real-estate job to start a petting zoo, and Natalie now leads a self-defense class. Henry arrives in school on his jet pack and is admired by fellow students.

In a mid-credits scene, Marlene and the nitwit get engaged, having learnt each other's languages.

In a post-credits scene, Steve heads back to his {{AMCM|149 Holly Oak Drive|home}} to retrieve his personal belongings from the attic. He is greeted by the current owner, a woman named {{AMCM|Alex}}.

== Production ==
=== Development ===
Following a series of offers from Hollywood producers to create a ''Minecraft''-related television series<ref>{{citation|url=http://www.vg247.com/2012/03/24/minecraft-hits-80m-in-sales-with-over-5m-paid-downloads/|title=Minecraft hits $80M in sales with over 5M paid downloads|section=|website=VG247|author=Stephany Nunneley|date=March 24, 2012|quote=|https://web.archive.org/web/20120326175441/http://www.vg247.com/2012/03/24/minecraft-hits-80m-in-sales-with-over-5m-paid-downloads/}}</ref> and a {{w|crowdfunding}} campaign for a {{w|fan film}} that was shut down by [[Markus Persson|Markus Persson]],<ref>{{citation|url=https://www.ign.com/articles/2014/02/07/minecraft-movie-the-birth-of-man-nixed-by-notch|title=Minecraft Movie 'The Birth of Man' Nixed by Notch|website=IGN|author=Seth G. Macy|date=February 7, 2014|https://web.archive.org/web/20220318093902/https://www.ign.com/articles/2014/02/07/minecraft-movie-the-birth-of-man-nixed-by-notch}}</ref> Notch announced on February 27, 2014 that [[Mojang Studios]] was working with {{w|Warner Bros.}} to make a ''Minecraft'' film, saying on Twitter that he wanted to be the one to leak it out.<ref>{{tweet|notch|439164234099073024|Someone is trying leak the fact that we're working with Warner Brothers on a potential Minecraft Movie. I wanted to be the leak!|February 27, 2014}}</ref> That same day, it was reported that {{w|Roy Lee}} and {{w|Jill Messick}} were added as producers.<ref>{{citation|url=https://deadline.com/2014/02/minecraft-movie-warner-bros-lego-movie-producer-690664/|title=Video Game Sensation 'Minecraft' Coming To The Big Screen As Warner Bros Acquires Rights; 'Lego's' Roy Lee And Jill Messick Producing|website=Deadline Hollywood|author=Anita Busch|date=February 27, 2014|https://web.archive.org/web/20140228170036/http://www.deadline.com/2014/02/minecraft-movie-warner-bros-lego-movie-producer/}}</ref>

On October 8, 2014, [[Vu Bui]] stated that the movie was in "its early days of development", saying that it was a "large-budget production" and that it was planned to release within three to four years.<ref name=guardian>{{citation|url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2014/oct/08/minecraft-movies-youtube-mojang-licensing?view=desktop/|title=Minecraft movie will be 'large-budget' but unlikely to arrive before 2017|website=The Guardian|author=Stuart Dredge|date=October 9, 2014|https://web.archive.org/web/20141021054937/http://www.theguardian.com/technology/2014/oct/08/minecraft-movies-youtube-mojang-licensing?view=desktop/}}</ref> Later that same month, it was reported that {{w|Shawn Levy}} would direct the film,<ref>{{citation|url=https://deadline.com/2014/10/minecraft-movie-shawn-levy-director-warner-bros-852503/|title=Shawn Levy Boards 'Minecraft' Movie|website=Deadline Hollywood|author=Mike Fleming Jr.|date=October 16, 2014|https://web.archive.org/web/20141017042554/http://deadline.com/2014/10/minecraft-movie-shawn-levy-director-warner-bros-852503/}}</ref> but soon left the project along with {{w|Kieran Mulroney|Kieran}} and Michele Mulroney, who were serving as writers, due to creative differences and scheduling conflicts. It was reported that Levy and the Mulroney's vision for the film didn't mesh well with what Mojang was looking for.<ref>{{citation|url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/shawn-levy-leaves-warner-bros-minecraft-film-exclusive-1201374902/|title=Shawn Levy Leaves Warner Bros.' 'Minecraft' Film|website=Variety|author=Justin Kroll|date=December 9, 2014|https://web.archive.org/web/20141226181754/http://variety.com/2014/film/news/shawn-levy-leaves-warner-bros-minecraft-film-exclusive-1201374902/}}</ref> Levy would later state in an interview that he envisioned a ''Minecraft'' film as an adventure movie with a ''{{w|The Goonies|Goonies}}'' flair.<ref>{{ytl|fp8D4MIkP70|'Minecraft' Movie: Why Director Shawn Levy Left|Wall Street Journal|December 12, 2014}}</ref>

On July 21, 2015, [[Vu Bui]] announced that {{w|Rob McElhenney}} would serve as the director of the film.<ref>{{citation|url=https://www.mojang.com/2015/07/weve-chosen-a-director-for-the-minecraft-movie/|title=We‚Äôve chosen a director for the Minecraft movie!|website=Mojang|author=Vu Bui|date=July 21, 2015|https://web.archive.org/web/20150811145023/https://www.mojang.com/2015/07/weve-chosen-a-director-for-the-minecraft-movie/}}</ref>

On June 27, 2016, Mojang Studios announced the title and release date for ''Minecraft: The Movie'' by showing the front cover of the script and publicly announcing a release date of May 24, 2019.<ref name="2019 may release">{{citation|url=http://www.mojang.com/2016/06/the-minecraft-movie-has-a-release-date/|title=THE MINECRAFT MOVIE HAS A RELEASE DATE!|website=Mojang|author=Vu Bui|date=June 27, 2016|https://web.archive.org/web/20160629183903/http://www.mojang.com/2016/06/the-minecraft-movie-has-a-release-date/}}</ref>

On October 13, 2016, it was reported that {{w|Jason Fuchs}} would be writing the script alongside McElhenney.<ref>{{citation|url=http://variety.com/2016/film/news/jason-fuchs-minecraft-movie-writer-1201888253/|title='Wonder Woman' Scribe Jason Fuchs to Write Latest Draft of 'Minecraft' (Exclusive)|website=Variety|author=Justin Kroll|date=October 13, 2016|https://web.archive.org/web/20161017174723/http://variety.com/2016/film/news/jason-fuchs-minecraft-movie-writer-1201888253/}}</ref> Producer {{w|Jill Messick}} committed suicide on February 7, 2018, making ''Minecraft: The Movie'' the last movie she worked on.<ref name=MCMovieNewDirector> {{citation|url=https://variety.com/2019/film/news/peter-sollett-warner-bros-minecraft-1203105640/|title=Peter Sollett to Direct Warner Bros.' 'Minecraft' Movie (Exclusive)|website=Variety|author=Justin Kroll|date=January 11, 2019|https://web.archive.org/web/20190112061341/https://variety.com/2019/film/news/peter-sollett-warner-bros-minecraft-1203105640/}}</ref>

On August 3, 2018, it was reported that Rob McElhenney and Jason Fuchs were replaced by writing duo {{w|Nee Brothers|Aaron and Adam Nee}} to rewrite the script. The film was taken off the release schedule as a result of the replacement.<ref name="release date">{{citation|url=https://www.thewrap.com/minecraft-nee-brothers-rob-mcelhenny-release-date/|title='Minecraft' Movie Delayed: Rob McElhenney Out as Director, Nee Brothers Tapped to Write (Exclusive)|website=The Wrap|author=Umberto Gonzalez and Tony Maglio|date=August 3, 2018|https://web.archive.org/web/20180804031124/https://www.thewrap.com/minecraft-nee-brothers-rob-mcelhenny-release-date/}}</ref> McElhenney would later state that he was drawn to the film because of the game's open-world nature and revealing that Warner Bros. had provided him with a preliminary $150 million budget. Studios in Vancouver were booked for filming by that point, but it "slowly died on the vine" when studio head Greg Silverman was replaced by {{w|Toby Emmerich}}, who had a different vision for the film.<ref>{{citation|url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/how-rob-mcelhenneys-150-million-minecraft-movie-fe/1100-6474007/|title=How Rob McElhenney's $150 Million Minecraft Movie Fell Apart After 2.5 Years Of Work|website=GameSpot|author=Eddie Makuch|date=February 23, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{citation|url=https://www.vg247.com/2020/02/24/minecraft-rob-mcelhenney-movie/|title=Always Sunny's Rob McElhenney explains what went wrong for his $150 Million Minecraft movie|website=VG247|author=Emily Gera|date=February 24, 2020|https://web.archive.org/web/20210308134126/https://www.vg247.com/2020/02/24/minecraft-rob-mcelhenney-movie/}}</ref>

On January 3, 2019, it was reported that {{w|Jim Berney}} has been appointed for the film's visual effects.<ref>{{citation|url=https://miamimorningstar.com/2019/01/05/minecraft-the-movie-after-significant-delays-finds-its-visual-effects-supervisor/|title=Minecraft: The Movie after Significant Delays Finds its Visual Effects Supervisor|website=Miami Morning Star|author=|date=January 5, 2019}}</ref> Later that same month, it was reported that {{w|Peter Sollett}} would write and direct the film, with Jon Berg being added as a producer, and {{w|Jon Spaihts}} being added as an executive producer, along with information about the plot revolving around the Ender Dragon destroying the Overworld.<ref name=MCMovieNewDirector/> This information would be confirmed the following April in a blog post made on [[Minecraft.net]], announcing that the film would be released on March 4, 2022.<ref name="March 2022">{{mcnet|the-minecraft-movie-is-just-around-the-corner|THE MINECRAFT MOVIE IS JUST AROUND THE CORNER|April 16, 2019|Staff}}<br>([https://web.archive.org/web/20210615162321/https://minecraft.net/en-us/article/the-minecraft-movie-is-just-around-the-corner archived])</ref> On June 24, 2019, it was reported that {{w|Allison Schroeder}} would be co-writing the latest script with Sollett for the film.<ref>{{citation|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/frozen-2-writer-allison-schroeder-tackling-minecraft-movie-1220710|title='Frozen 2' Writer Allison Schroeder Tackling 'Minecraft' Movie|website=The Hollywood Reporter|author=Borys Kit|date=June 24, 2019|https://web.archive.org/web/20190625022152/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/frozen-2-writer-allison-schroeder-tackling-minecraft-movie-1220710}}</ref>

On April 18, 2022, it was reported that Sollett had departed the project, with [[Jared Hess]] taking over to direct the film while Chris Bowman and {{w|Hubbel Palmer}} were set to write the latest script. [[Lydia Winters]] and {{w|Mary Parent}} were also added as producers, while {{w|Cale Boyter}} was also added as an executive producer.<ref name=Direct>[https://thedirect.com/article/jason-momoa-minecraft-movie Jason Momoa Reportedly In Talks to Join Minecraft Movie] - The Direct; April 18, 2022</ref><ref name=Momoa>[https://deadline.com/2022/04/jason-momoa-in-talks-to-star-in-warner-bros-adaptation-of-minecraft-1235005112/ Jason Momoa In Early Talks To Star In 'Minecraft'; Jared Hess Directing Video Game Adaptation For Warner Bros.] ‚Äì Deadline Hollywood; April 18, 2022</ref> Hess would later state that he would be attempting to avoid "an ugly Sonic situation", referencing the first trailer for the {{w|Sonic the Hedgehog (film)|first ''Sonic the Hedgehog'' film}}, and said that he wouldn‚Äôt want to disappoint anyone regarding his vision for the film.<ref name=UglySonic>[https://www.sltrib.com/artsliving/2024/01/14/utah-filmmakers-talk-about-their/ What happened after 'Napoleon Dynamite' ‚Äî and the big movie its Utah filmmakers are making next] ‚Äì The Salt Lake Tribune; January 14, 2024</ref>

On April 5, 2023, it was reported that the film is now slated to release on April 4, 2025.<ref name=Four425>[https://deadline.com/2023/04/aquaman-2-minecraft-wise-guys-color-purple-release-dates-1235318958/ 'Aquaman 2' Shifts Release Date Five Days Earlier, Warner Bros Dates 'The Wise Guys', 'Minecraft'] ‚Äì Deadline Hollywood; April 5, 2023</ref>

On May 23, 2023, it was reported that Jason Momoa and Torfi Frans Olafsson were added as producers.<ref name=Berry>[https://deadline.com/2023/05/minecraft-matt-berry-jason-momoa-warner-bros-1235370880/ Matt Berry In Talks To Join Jason Momoa In Warner Bros' 'Minecraft'] ‚Äì Deadline Hollywood; May 23, 2023</ref>

On January 14, 2024, Jared Hess would confirm in an interview that {{w|Grant Major}} had been hired to work on production design for the film.<ref name=UglySonic/>

=== Casting ===
In November 2016, it was reported that {{w|Steve Carell}} was in talks to star in the film,<ref>[https://variety.com/2016/film/news/steve-carell-minecraft-movie-warner-bros-1201918908/ Steve Carell in Talks to Join ‚ÄòMinecraft‚Äô Movie at Warner Bros. (EXCLUSIVE)] ‚Äì Variety; November 15, 2016</ref> but left the project due to scheduling conflicts.<ref name=MCMovieNewDirector/>

In April 2022, it was reported that [[Jason Momoa]] was in talks to star in the film.<ref name=Momoa/>

In May 2023, it was reported that {{w|Matt Berry}} was in talks to star in the film.<ref name=Berry/>

In November 2023, it was reported that [[Danielle Brooks]] and [[Sebastian Eugene Hansen]] were in talks to star in the film as the characters Dawn and Henry, respectively.<ref name=DawnHenry>[https://deadline.com/2023/11/minecraft-jason-momoa-danielle-brooks-sebastian-eugene-hansen-1235646560/ ‚ÄòMinecraft‚Äô: Warner Bros Movie Adds Danielle Brooks & Sebastian Eugene Hansen] ‚Äì Deadline Hollywood; November 30, 2023</ref> The following month, it was reported that [[Emma Myers]] was also in talks to star.<ref>[https://deadline.com/2023/12/minecraft-emma-myers-wednesday-1235655987/ 'Minecraft': 'Wednesday' Star Emma Myers Digs Into Warner Bros Movie] ‚Äì Deadline Hollywood; December 6, 2023</ref> [[Jack Black]] would later join the cast as [[Steve]] in January 2024 alongside [[Jennifer Coolidge]], {{w|Kate McKinnon}}, and {{w|Jemaine Clement}}.<ref name=JackSteve>[https://deadline.com/2024/01/minecraft-jack-black-1235693816/ Jack Black Levels Up For 'Minecraft' At Warner Bros] ‚Äì Deadline Hollywood; January 2, 2024</ref><ref name="FilmBegan">{{Citation|url=https://deadline.com/2024/01/minecraft-jennifer-coolidge-1235795092/|title=Warner Bros‚Äô Jason Momoa 'Minecraft' Movie Finds Gem In Jennifer Coolidge ‚Äì ;|author=Anthony D'Alessandro|website=Deadline Hollywood|date=January 17, 2024}}</ref><ref>[https://deadline.com/2024/01/minecraft-kate-mckinnon-jemaine-clement-1235796568/ Kate McKinnon & Jemaine Clement Join Jason Momoa ‚ÄòMinecraft‚Äô Gang At Warner Bros] ‚Äì Deadline Hollywood; January 18, 2024</ref> Jack Black was originally cast as a talking pig, but his character was changed to Steve late in the film's development.<ref>{{citation|url=https://variety.com/2025/film/news/a-minecraft-movie-game-microsoft-1236341672/|title=Crafting a Blockbuster: How ‚ÄòA Minecraft Movie‚Äô Brought the Wacky, Cubic Video Game to Life|author=Jennifer Mass and Katcy Stephan|website=Variety|date=March 19, 2025}}</ref>

In September 2024, {{w|Valkyrae}} revealed she had a role in the film, but it was cut from the final version.<ref>{{citation |date=September 14, 2024 |title=Valkyrae reveals awkward on-set encounter with Jason Momoa in Minecraft movie |url=https://www.mundodeportivo.com/us/en/20240914/700918/valkyrae-reveals-awkward-on-set-encounter-with-jason-momoa-in-minecraft-movie.html |access-date=September 14, 2024 |website=Mundo Deportivo USA}}</ref>

=== Filming ===
[[File:Jason Momoa Instagram photo.jpg|200px|thumb|The photo posted on Instagram showing Momoa, Black and other members after filming had wrapped]]
In June 2023, it was reported that filming was slated to begin in August 2023 in New Zealand<!-- please do not change this to Aotearoa; although it is the current name given by the MƒÅori people, it is not listed in the references, nor does Wikipedia use that name in the main heading of the respective article or the article about this film. -->, however it was delayed to January 2024 due to the {{w|2023 SAG-AFTRA strike}}.<ref>[https://coveredgeekly.com/live-action-minecraft-movie-set-to-begin-filming-soon-first-location-revealed-report/ Live-Action ‚ÄòMinecraft‚Äô Movie Set To Begin Filming Soon, First Location Revealed (Report)] ‚Äì Covered Geekly; June 25, 2023</ref><ref name=JackSteve/> Filming officially began that month and {{w|Wrap (filmmaking)|wrapped}} on April 12, 2024, with Jason Momoa posting a photo of some of the cast and crew on Instagram to mark the occasion.<ref name=FilmBegan/><ref>[https://www.instagram.com/p/C5phZ3cu_BG/?igsh=aDE4ZG1udjN5cGo= Jason Momoa (prideofgypsies) on Instagram:] "MINECRAFT WE ARE WRAPPING All my aloha to my crew and cast. Unbelievable movie experience truly one of the greatest times of my life. Too many laughs. I love this country. AOTEAROA New Zealand <!-- do not change "New Zealand" to "Aotearoa". This is exactly as quoted from the source. -->you are magical. Mahalo for letting me film here. SPECIAL PRESENT TO OUR CREW from @slowtide and @soill in support of @peoplesfundofmaui." ‚Äì April 12, 2024</ref>

== Release ==
=== Theatrical ===
The film was distributed by Warner Bros. Pictures and was theatrically released in the United States on April 4, 2025.<ref name=Four425/> It was originally scheduled to be released on May 24, 2019,<ref name="2019 may release"/> but was then taken off the release schedule in August 2018 due to the aforementioned replacement of McElhenney and Fuchs. In April 2019, it was announced that the film would be released on March 4, 2022,<ref name="March 2022"/> but it was again taken off the release schedule in October 2020 due to the {{w|COVID-19 pandemic}}, with ''{{w|The Batman (film)|The Batman}}'' taking its place.<ref>[https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/the-batman-delays-release-to-2022-as-warner-bros-shuffles-calendar 'The Batman' Delays Release to 2022 as Warner Bros. Shuffles Calendar] ‚Äì The Hollywood Reporter; October 5, 2020</ref> The movie then moved to its current release date of April 4, 2025, in April 2023.<ref name=Four425/> It was released April 2&ndash;4, 2025, globally.<ref>
[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt3566834/releaseinfo Release info] - A Minecraft Movie - IMDB</ref>

=== Home media ===
On May 7, 2025, it was announced that the film would be released on digital storefronts on May 13, 2025.<ref>{{tweet|AMinecraftMovie|1920131582662156299|Lose your chicken-jockeying mind with #MinecraftMovie - available on Digital 5/13!|May 7, 2025}}</ref> The digital film contains some behind the scenes videos, including {{AMCM|Building the World of Minecraft: Block Party}}, {{AMCM|Creepers, Zombies, and Endermen Oh My!}}, {{AMCM|Pixel Pals}}, {{AMCM|Block Beats}}, and {{AMCM|Marlene + Nitwit}}.{{Citation needed}}

On May 13, 2025, it was announced that the film would be released physically in {{w|DVD-Video|DVD}}, {{w|Blu-ray}}, and {{w|Ultra HD Blu-ray|4K Ultra HD}} formats on June 24, 2025.<ref>{{citation|url=https://variety.com/2025/shopping/news/how-to-watch-a-minecraft-movie-online-1236394129/|title='A Minecraft Movie' Releases on Digital, Sets DVD/4K Ultra HD Steelbook Release Date|author=Rudie Obias|website=Variety|date=May 13, 2025}}</ref>

=== Marketing ===
On September 4, 2024, a teaser trailer and a poster were released. These are what first revealed the film's title, characters, and look.<ref name="Teaser"/><ref>{{tweet|AMinecraftMovie|1831315023106568548|A new kind of block-buster. #MinecraftMovie - only in theaters 2025.|September 4, 2024}}</ref>

On September 28, 2024, at [[Minecraft Live 2024]], a talk about the film with Torfi Frans Ofalsson and Jared Hess was featured, as well as behind-the-scenes footage and a short clip from the film.<ref name="MCLive24">{{ytl|Xgr9bVmCPHo|Minecraft Live 2024: A MINECRAFT MOVIE <nowiki>|</nowiki> EXCLUSIVE INSIGHT|Minecraft|September 28, 2024}}</ref>

On November 18, 2024, a short behind the scenes video was released, along with a caption announcing a new trailer releasing on November 19.<ref>{{tweet|Minecraft|1858555800953729146|A world only you can make. #MinecraftMovie trailer tomorrow.|November 18, 2024}}</ref>

On November 19, 2024, a full trailer and a second teaser poster were released.<ref name=official>{{ytl|wJO_vIDZn-I|A Minecraft Movie <nowiki>|</nowiki> Official Trailer|Warner Bros. Pictures|November 19, 2024}}</ref>

On February 27, 2025, the final trailer and theatrical posters were released.<ref name=final>{{ytl|8B1EtVPBSMw|A Minecraft Movie <nowiki>|</nowiki> Final Trailer|Warner Bros. Pictures|February 27, 2025}}</ref>

== Reception ==
=== Box office ===
On March 21, 2025, ''A Minecraft Movie'' was projected to gross $60‚Äì75 million in the United States and Canada on its opening weekend.<ref>{{citation|url=https://www.boxofficepro.com/long-range-forecast-can-sinners-bring-new-life-to-april-box-office/|title=Long Range Forecast: Can SINNERS Bring New Life to the April Box Office?|website=Boxoffice Pro|author=Boxoffice Staff|date=March 21, 2025}}</ref> Further projections in April estimated the film to gross a total of $140 million worldwide in its opening weekend.<ref>{{citation|url=https://deadline.com/2025/04/a-minecraft-movie-box-office-preview-1236357167/|title='A Minecraft Movie' Looks To Build $140M+ Global Gold Mine In Barren Desert Box Office ‚Äì Preview|website=Deadline Hollywood|author=Anthony D'Alessandro and Nancy Tartaglione|date=April 2, 2025}}</ref>

Domestically, the film grossed $10.55 million in Thursday night previews<ref>{{citation|url=https://variety.com/2025/film/news/minecraft-movie-box-office-previews-1236358670/|title=Box Office: 'A Minecraft Movie' Makes $10.55 Million in Previews|author=Jordan Moreau|website=Variety|date=April 4, 2025}}</ref>, and grossed $47.45 million on opening day, for a domestic total of $58 million at that point.<ref>{{citation|url=https://deadline.com/2025/04/box-office-a-minecraft-movie-1236359247/|title='A Minecraft Movie' Mania Grips Nation, Opening Now At $135M+ For Warner Bros Legendary Pic ‚Äì Update|website=Deadline Hollywood|author=Anthony D'Alessandro|date=April 5, 2025}}</ref>

In the film's opening weekend, it over-performed expectations and grossed $301 million worldwide, surpassing ''{{w|Nacho Libre}}'' as Jared Hess' highest-grossing film and being the #1 film at the domestic box office.<ref>{{citation|url=https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/warner-bros-a-minecraft-movie-smashes-box-office-estimates-increasing-sequel-potential-1034556843|title=Warner Bros‚Äô A Minecraft Movie Smashes Box Office Estimates, Increasing Sequel Potential|author=TipRanks|website=Market Insider|date=April 7, 2025}}</ref> In its second weekend, the film's gross increased to $550 million, surpassing ''{{w|Sonic the Hedgehog 3 (film)|Sonic the Hedgehog 3}}'' as the second-highest grossing film based on a video game, behind ''{{w|The Super Mario Bros. Movie}}''.<ref>{{citation|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/minecraft-box-office-king-of-kings-amateur-1236189368/?pubDate=20250413|title=Box Office: ‚ÄòMinecraft‚Äô Mints More Gold With $80.6M, ‚ÄòKing of Kings‚Äô Leads New Films With $19M|author=Pamela McClintock|website=The Hollywood Reporter|date=April 13, 2025}}</ref> In its third weekend, it dropped from the top spot domestically, but its gross increased to $720 million.<ref>{{citation|url=https://deadline.com/2025/04/minecraft-sinners-detective-conan-international-box-office-1236372567/|title=‚ÄòA Minecraft Movie‚Äô Builds To $721M Global, ‚ÄòSinners‚Äô Feasts On $61M WW Bow ‚Äì International Box Office|author=Nancy Tartaglione|website=Deadline Hollywood|date=April 20, 2025}}</ref> By its fourth weekend, the film's gross increased to $816 million, and by its sixth, it increased further to $909 million.<ref>{{citation|url=https://deadline.com/2025/04/minecraft-sinners-revenge-of-the-sith-star-wars-accountant-global-international-box-office-1236378181/|title=‚ÄòMinecraft‚Äô On Another Level With $817M Global, ‚ÄòSinners‚Äô Holdover Halo Takes WW To $162M, ‚ÄòRevenge Of The Sith‚Äô Galactic At $42M+ Reissue & ‚ÄòAccountant 2‚Äô Puts $38M On The Books ‚Äì International Box Office|author=Nancy Tartaglione|website=Deadline Hollywood|date=April 27, 2025}}</ref><ref>{{citation|url=https://deadline.com/2025/05/thunderbolts-minecraft-global-international-box-office-1236392821/|title=‚ÄòThunderbolts*‚Äô Nears $300M Global As Does ‚ÄòSinners‚Äô; ‚ÄòMinecraft‚Äôs Whole Lotta Lava Tops $900M WW & $500M Overseas ‚Äì International Box Office|author=Nancy Tartaglione|website=Deadline Hollywood|date=May 11, 2025}}</ref> In its seventh weekend, the film's gross increased slightly to $928 million.<ref>{{citation|url=https://deadline.com/2025/05/final-destination-bloodlines-thunderbolts-global-box-office-1236403058/|title=‚ÄòFinal Destination Bloodlines‚Äô Arrives With $102M Global Bow; ‚ÄòThunderbolts*‚Äô & ‚ÄòSinners‚Äô Top $300M WW ‚Äì International Box Office|author=Nancy Tartaglione|website=Deadline Hollywood|date=May 18, 2025}}</ref>

=== Critical response ===
{{rewrite|Most, if not all, of this section is plagiarised from Wikipedia as a placeholder.|section=yes|date=April 22, 2025}}
On the review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes, 48% of 136 critics' reviews are positive, with an average rating of 5.1/10. The website's consensus reads: "Ostensibly a film about celebrating creativity, ''A Minecraft Movie'' provides a colorful sandbox for Jack Black and Jason Momoa to amusingly romp around in a story curiously constructed from conventional building blocks."<ref>[https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/a_minecraft_movie "A Minecraft Movie"]. Rotten Tomatoes. Fandango Media. Retrieved April 9, 2025.</ref> Metacritic, which uses a weighted average, assigned the film a score of 47 out of 100, based on 37 critics, indicating "mixed or average" reviews.<ref>[https://www.metacritic.com/movie/a-minecraft-movie "A Minecraft Movie"]. Metacritic. Fandom, Inc. Retrieved April 5, 2025.</ref> Audience reactions to the film were more positive in comparison to critics;<ref>{{citation |last=Bahr |first=Lindsey |title=Hollywood lands a much-needed box office hit with 'A Minecraft Movie' |url=https://abcnews.go.com/Business/wireStory/hollywood-lands-needed-box-office-hit-minecraft-movie-120539379 |access-date=April 7, 2025 |website=ABC News |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{citation |date=April 6, 2025 |title=Audience digs 'A Minecraft Movie' |url=https://www.bostonherald.com/2025/04/06/audience-digs-a-minecraft-movie/ |access-date=April 7, 2025 |website=Boston Herald |language=en-US}}</ref> CinemaScore gave the film an average grade of "B+" on an A+ to F scale, while 67% of those surveyed by PostTrak said they would definitely recommend the film. Kids under the age of 12 gave the film an average rating of five out of five stars, while parents gave an average of four and a half out of five stars.<ref name="opening">{{citation |last=D'Alessandro |first=Anthony |date=April 4, 2025 |title='A Minecraft Movie' Massive $100M+ U.S. Opening, Best YTD, Warner Bros & Legendary Resurrect Box Office ‚Äì Update |url=https://deadline.com/2025/04/box-office-a-minecraft-movie-1236359247/ |access-date=April 5, 2025 |website=Deadline |language=en-US}}</ref>

Critics were divided on the film's plot and whether or not ''A Minecraft Movie'' was a faithful adaptation of the game, as well as if it made sense to viewers unfamiliar with it. Lovia Gyarkye of ''The Hollywood Reporter'' and Jesse Hassenger of ''IGN'' both believed that the film's plot was confusing. Gyarkye felt that it struggled to maintain a balance between appeasing the ''Minecraft'' fandom and writing a film that made sense to a general audience, and Hassenger said that the film was "conceptually muddy" and "confusingly and erratically presented".<ref name=":8">{{citation |last=Gyarkye |first=Lovia |date=April 2, 2025 |title='A Minecraft Movie' Review: Jason Momoa and Jack Black Lead Unimaginative Video-Game Adventure Comedy |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-reviews/a-minecraft-movie-review-jason-momoa-jack-black-1236179043/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.today/20250404234852/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-reviews/a-minecraft-movie-review-jason-momoa-jack-black-1236179043/ |archive-date=April 4, 2025 |access-date=April 5, 2025 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}}</ref><ref name=":7">{{citation |last=Hassenger |first=Jesse |date=April 3, 2025 |title=A Minecraft Movie Review |url=https://www.ign.com/articles/a-minecraft-movie-review-jack-black-jason-momoa |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250404031207/https://www.ign.com/articles/a-minecraft-movie-review-jack-black-jason-momoa |archive-date=April 4, 2025 |access-date=April 5, 2025 |work=IGN}}</ref> Mark Kennedy of the ''Associated Press'' believed that the film would likely make no sense to a viewer unfamiliar with the source material, but still believed that it was a faithful adaptation. However, he did highlight the films featuring concepts not present within the game itself to enable plot progression.<ref name=":22">{{citation |last=Kennedy |first=Mark |date=April 3, 2025 |title=Movie Review: Jason Momoa shines in 'A Minecraft Movie' |url=https://apnews.com/article/minecraft-movie-review-876031841a9fb0cf4f147861f5ca7f81 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250403002309/https://apnews.com/article/minecraft-movie-review-876031841a9fb0cf4f147861f5ca7f81 |archive-date=April 3, 2025 |access-date=April 5, 2025 |work=The Associated Press}}</ref> Contrarily, Liz Shannon Miller of ''Consequence'' believed that the plot was fully comprehensible to someone unfamiliar with the game.<ref name=":11">{{citation |date=April 2, 2025 |title=A Minecraft Movie Review: Worthy of Jack Black's Talents |url=https://consequence.net/2025/04/a-minecraft-movie-review-jack-black/ |access-date=April 5, 2025 |website=Consequence |language=en-US}}</ref> Some reviewers viewed the fan service present within the film positively,<ref name=":9">{{citation |last=Park |first=Gene |date=April 3, 2025 |title=With Jack Black and Jason Momoa aboard, 'A Minecraft Movie' roars |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/movies/2025/04/03/minecraft-movie-jack-black-jason-momoa/ |url-access=subscription |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250403214810/https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/movies/2025/04/03/minecraft-movie-jack-black-jason-momoa/ |archive-date=April 3, 2025 |access-date=April 5, 2025 |work=The Washington Post}}</ref><ref name=":122">{{citation |last=Nicholson |first=Amy |date=April 2, 2025 |title=Review: 'A Minecraft Movie' is a block of big dumb fun |url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/movies/story/2025-04-02/a-minecraft-movie-review-jack-black-jared-hess-jason-momoa-jennifer-coolidge |access-date=April 5, 2025 |website=Los Angeles Times |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{citation |last=Marshall |first=Cass |date=April 2, 2025 |title=A Minecraft Movie tries to construct a captivating tale, but falls off the rails |url=https://www.polygon.com/review/551004/minecraft-movie-jack-black-jason-momoa |access-date=April 5, 2025 |website=Polygon |language=en-US}}</ref> particularly highlighting the tribute to [[Technoblade]].<ref name=":9" /><ref name=":122" />

The performances of the cast were praised. Many viewed their performances as helping alleviate or distract any problems present within the film's plot.<ref name=":7" /><ref name=":8" /> Black and Momoa, in particular, received a lot of praise.<ref name=":7" /><ref name=":11" /> Miller and Jordan Hoffman of ''Entertainment Weekly'' both felt that the story was not the main priority of the film and could be ignored in favor of the performance of the actors, the former believing that the film was mainly made with the intent of having fun.<ref name=":11" /><ref name=":10">{{citation |last=Hoffman |first=Jordan |title='A Minecraft Movie' review: Jason Momoa mines comedy gold in surprisingly well-crafted adaptation |url=https://ew.com/minecraft-review-jason-momoa-mines-gold-surprisingly-well-crafted-comedy-11706595 |access-date=April 5, 2025 |website=EW.com |language=en}}</ref> However, some viewed that the characters, despite the performances of their actors, were generally underdeveloped.<ref name=":11" /><ref name=":8" /> The sub-plot involving Coolidge's character dating a villager, while viewed as generally unnecessary or relatively thin in terms of character development, was subject to considerable praise.<ref name=":11" /><ref name=":8" /><ref name=":7" />

Some reviewers questioned the purpose or value of the film, with some viewing it as nothing more than a product with the intent of promoting ''Minecraft''. Both Kevin Maher of ''The Times'' and David Fear of ''Rolling Stone'' likened the film to a corporate cash-grab, viewing it as existing with the sole purpose of promoting the ''Minecraft'' brand and offering nothing else of value.<ref name=":02">{{citation |last=Maher |first=Kevin |date=April 3, 2025 |title=A Minecraft Movie review ‚Äî zero stars for this unforgivable disaster |url=https://www.thetimes.com/culture/film/article/minecraft-movie-review-jason-momoa-jack-black-vb7rw322d |url-access=subscription |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.today/20250404001601/https://www.thetimes.com/culture/film/article/minecraft-movie-review-jason-momoa-jack-black-vb7rw322d |archive-date=April 4, 2025 |access-date=April 5, 2025 |work=The Times}}</ref><ref>{{citation |last=Fear |first=David |date=April 3, 2025 |title='A Minecraft Movie' Is Exactly What You Think It Will Be, and Less |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/tv-movies/tv-movie-reviews/a-minecraft-movie-review-jack-black-jason-momoa-1235305443/ |access-date=April 5, 2025 |website=Rolling Stone |language=en-US}}</ref> Maher further viewed the film as lacking a level of versatility present in other video game adaptations, while Fear believed that the film was intentionally confusing so that it would stay in the minds of people longer, and therefore encourage them to purchase merchandise.<ref name=":02" /> While Clarisse Loughrey of ''The Independent'' believed that the idea behind a live-action ''Minecraft'' adaptation was fundamentally flawed and destroyed the spirit of the source material, she felt that the film had "genuine intent" and was not like other adaptations that she viewed as existing solely for the sake of profit.<ref>{{citation |last=Loughrey |first=Clarisse |date=April 2, 2025 |title=In A Minecraft Movie, Jack Black is like a desperate clown at an underattended children's party |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/reviews/minecraft-movie-review-jack-black-cast-release-date-b2726057.html |access-date=April 5, 2025 |work=The Independent |language=en}}</ref>

=== Cinema reactions ===
{{See also|Movie:Chicken Jockey sensation}}
In theatres, fans would cheer whenever any of Black's lines from the trailer were said in the film, such as "''I am Steve''", "''Flint and steel!''", and most notably, "''Chicken jockey!''".<ref>{{citation|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c1egn9y9ljno|title=Minecraft Movie sparks raucous reactions from fans|author=Helen Bushby|website=BBC News|date=April 8, 2025}}</ref> In one example of the latter, someone had brought in a live chicken to a screening in Provo, Utah, subsequently being removed from the showing.<ref>{{citation|url=https://www.sltrib.com/news/2025/04/12/someone-provo-brought-live-chicken/|title=Provo fans brought a chicken to a ‚ÄòMinecraft‚Äô screening and it went viral|author=Brock Merchant|website=The Salt Lake Tribune|date=April 12, 2025}}</ref>

Observers would later note that the reactions to the film were becoming a cultural phenomenon, comparing it to screenings of ''{{w|The Rocky Horror Picture Show}}'' and ''{{w|The Room}}''.<ref>{{citation|url=https://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/minecraft-movie-cinema-trend-1.7503571|title=Chicken jockey! A Minecraft Movie is causing chaos in cinemas and debate over audience etiquette|author=Natalie Stechyson|website=CBC News|date=April 7, 2025}}</ref>

Warner Bros. would later capitalize on the trend by announcing a "Block Party Edition" of the film, which was shown in theaters from May 2, 2025 until the end of its theatrical run.<ref>{{citation|url=https://businesswire.com/news/home/20250428434675/en/A-Minecraft-Movie-Block-Party-Edition|title=''A Minecraft Movie: Block Party Edition!'' - The Year‚Äôs BLOCKbuster Phenomenon gets Lyrical‚ÄîBeginning Friday May 2, Audiences can Sing (and Meme) Along with 2025‚Äôs Biggest Hit!|author=Chelsey Summey|website=Warner Bros. via Business Wire|date=April 28, 2025}}</ref>

== Sequel ==
{{main|Untitled A Minecraft Movie sequel}}
On March 30, 2025, during the {{AMCM|green carpet}} premiere, Jared Hess expressed interest in the idea of making a sequel, noting the world's use of infinite mods, characters, and biomes, outlining how Minecraft is virtually endless.<ref>{{tweet|Variety|1906351446829768808|Would #AMinecraftMovie director Jared Hess make a sequel?<br><br>‚ÄúYes! It would be so much fun to go back into this world and go on another crazy adventure."<br>variety.com/2025/film/global/jack-black-hosting-snl-20-years-night-terrors-1236352004/|March 30, 2025}}</ref><ref>{{citation|url=https://www.gamesradar.com/entertainment/adventure-movies/a-minecraft-movie-director-jared-hess-says-hes-interested-in-making-a-sequel-there-are-so-many-amazing-mods-and-characters-and-biomes-we-havent-explored-yet|title=A Minecraft Movie director Jared Hess says he‚Äôs interested in making a sequel: "There are so many amazing mods and characters and biomes we haven't explored yet"|website=gamesradar.com|date=April 4, 2025}}</ref> He later stated that there were many ideas they had for the film that they were unable to use, but would likely be included as part of a sequel.<ref name=deadline>{{citation|url=https://deadline.com/2025/04/minecraft-movie-sequel-plans-director-jared-hess-jack-black-jason-momoa-1236362421/|title="'A Minecraft Movie's Jared Hess Talks Sequel, The Man Crush Between Jack Black And Jason Momoa & Hitting Zeitgeist Gold Decades After 'Napoleon Dynamite'"|website=deadline.com|date=April 7, 2025}}</ref>

On April 2, 2025, Jack Black, the actor for Steve, and Jason Momoa, the actor for Garret Garrison, were asked many questions in a Q&A for the movie. Black was asked if he would be playing [[Herobrine]] in a sequel. His response was "Dude, you want to know if there‚Äôs Hero Brian in the sequel? We don‚Äôt know. We don't know... I hope so."<ref>{{citation|url=https://www.abc4.com/dailydish/see-it-or-skip-it/exclusive-jack-black-jason-momoa-answer-questions-from-utah-kids-ahead-of-a-minecraft-movie/|title=EXCLUSIVE: Jack Black & Jason Momoa answer questions from Utah kids ahead of ‚ÄòA Minecraft Movie‚Äô|website=abc4.com|date=April 2, 2025}}</ref>

On April 4, 2025, Emma Myers and Sebastian Hansen told Yahoo UK how likely they thought a sequel would be. Emma said that she would love to do as many as they want, saying "Oh yeah, please. Minecraft 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 ‚Äî as many as they'll have me in I would love to do!". Sebastain revealed that it would be  be "great [to] keep it going" but also is unsure how it could go about because of the way in which the movie tells a story entirely new to the world of the game so that means a potential sequel could go anywhere and do anything, which is an overwhelming concept.<ref>{{citation|url=https://uk.movies.yahoo.com/movies/will-be-minecraft-movie-2-cast-sequel-interview-095306480.html|title=Will there be A Minecraft Movie 2? Cast share how likely a sequel will be|website=yahoo.com|date=April 4, 2025}}</ref>

On April 8, 2025, Jared Hess said that there were talks about a sequel in development.<ref>{{citation|url=https://gamefragger.com/multiplatform/massively-multiplayer/minecraft/a-minecraft-movie-sequel-already-in-talks-after-record-breaking-box-office-opening-a27168|title=A MINECRAFT MOVIE Sequel Already In Talks After Record-Breaking Box Office Opening|website=Game Fragger|date=April 13, 2025}}</ref> On April 11, 2025, it was reported by several outlets that a sequel is in early development.<ref>{{citation|url=https://comicbook.com/gaming/news/a-minecraft-movie-sequel-is-being-made/|title=A Minecraft Movie Sequel Is Reportedly Already In The Works|website=Comicbook.com|date=April 13, 2025}}</ref> A day later, the CEO of Warner Bros. confirmed that there will be a follow-up film.<ref>{{citation|url=https://www.pcgamer.com/movies-tv/warner-bros-suits-confirm-a-minecraft-movie-will-be-getting-a-sequel-the-ink-might-not-be-dry-but-imminently/|title=Warner Bros suits confirm A Minecraft Movie will be getting a sequel: 'The ink might not be dry‚Ä¶ but imminently'|section=|website=Pcgamer.com|author=Rich Stanton|date=April 14, 2025|quote="It was a complete win for everyone involved."|archive-url=}}</ref>

At the end of an interview discussing the film, the VFX supervisor Sheldon Stopsack and the animation supervisor Kevin Estey both refer to a hypothetical sequel as "Another Minecraft Movie".<ref name=sequelname>{{citation|url=https://www.artofvfx.com/a-minecraft-movie-sheldon-stopsack-vfx-supervisor-kevin-estey-animation-supervisor-weta-fx/|title=A Minecraft Movie: Sheldon Stopsack (VFX Supervisor) & Kevin Estey (Animation Supervisor) ‚Äì Weta FX|section=What is your next project?|website=[https://www.artofvfx.com/ The Art of VFX]|author=Vincent Frei|date=May 12, 2025|quote=SS ‚Äì Unfortunately I am unable to disclose that information .. but I hope that there might be ‚ÄúAnother Minecraft Movie‚Äù somewhere down the line and we can all do this again.<br><br>KE ‚Äì Currently that‚Äôs something that I can‚Äôt disclose, but I CAN disclose that I‚Äôm ready for Another Minecraft Movie if we can be so fortunate to enjoy another journey into the weird and wonderful world.|archive-url}}</ref> is already in early development.<ref>{{citation|url=https://gamefragger.com/multiplatform/massively-multiplayer/minecraft/a-minecraft-movie-sequel-already-in-talks-after-record-breaking-box-office-opening-a27168|title=A MINECRAFT MOVIE Sequel Already In Talks After Record-Breaking Box Office Opening|website=Game Fragger|date=April 13, 2025}}</ref>

On October 9, 2025, the official ''A Minecraft Movie'' Twitter account posted a teaser of two iron pickaxes on a crafting table announcing that a sequel was set to release on July 23, 2027.<ref>{{tweet|AMinecraftMovie|1976341544266498142|Building terrain. See you in theaters July 23 2027. #Minecraft|October 9, 2025}}</ref>

== Trivia ==
* ''A Minecraft Movie'' was briefly shelved during its development.<ref>https://zerply.com/r/29FegFpw/minecraft-villager</ref>
* On Twitter/X, [[Jeb]] teased that the piglins in the movie survive in the Overworld by using {{AMCM|Nether wart}} in the same way as the {{MCL|piglin}}s from ''[[Minecraft Legends]]''.<ref>{{Tweet|jeb_|1833656219795681736|A movie teaser note: In Minecraft Legends the piglins used netherwart to survive the overworld...|September 10, 2024}}</ref>
* Jared Hess's reasoning of naming the film ''A Minecraft Movie'' as opposed to ''The Minecraft Movie'' was that "the game does not have a definitive way to play; there are an overwhelming amount of stories that can be told in ''Minecraft'', and he states that is simply one of those stories".<ref name="MCLive24"/>
* In the film, a snippet of "[[Minecraft (song)|Minecraft]]" by [[C418]] can be heard.
* When {{AMCM|Matty The Waitress}} asks {{AMCM|Marlene}} if she and Nitwit are "finished", Marlene responds, "No, I think he's Swedish." This is a reference to the game's studio originating and being situated in Sweden.
* In a workprint of the film, "{{Wikipedia|DJ Got Us Fallin' in Love}}" by Usher plays during the credits, notably being the same song remixed into the ''Minecraft'' pastiche "Revenge" by [[CaptainSparklez]] and TryHardNinja. The song is replaced by the original song "Zero to Hero" in the final cut.{{Citation needed}}
* During the Midport Village introduction scene, a {{AMCM|pig}} is seen wearing a crown, which Steve states is a "legend". This is a tribute to late YouTuber [[Technoblade]], who passed away from his battle with sarcoma cancer mid-2022. In a later interview, it was revealed that Sebastian Hansen, who plays {{AMCM|Henry}} in the film, was the one to suggest the reference.<ref>{{citation|url=https://collider.com/a-minecraft-movie-easter-eggs-technoblade-director-jared-hess-torfi-frans-olafsson/|title="There‚Äôs a Really, Really Sweet, Special Nod to Technoblade": 'A Minecraft Movie' Director Jared Hess on Tributes and Easter Eggs|author=Jake Weisman and Steven Weintraub|website=Collider|date=April 5, 2025}}</ref>
* During the enderman nightmare scene, Steve is shown with white eyes similarly to [[Herobrine]]. When asked about it, [[Torfi Frans Olafsson]] joked that it was unintentional.<ref>{{Tweet|torfi_F_Olafss|1908910433018491319|It‚Äôs super strange that all of their eyes were supposed to be purple but when it was rendered one of the characters eyes kept coming out white in the final rendered frames so we wound up keeping it like that, because the VFX studio ran out of time.|April 6, 2025}}</ref>
